main_definition: In simple English, 'ward' primarily means a person under the protection of another or an area within a building divided by walls.

meanings_and_examples.example: After her surgery, Mary was moved to the cardiac ward for recovery.
The library is organized into different reading rooms or 'wards' based on genres and topics.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To direct someone to do something
meanings_and_examples.example: I ward you against the sun by telling you to wear a hat outside.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A unit of local government, especially in Scotland and Ireland
meanings_and_examples.example: The residents of this town vote for their Ward Councilor every four years.
